cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 95 mi (155 km) ESE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn north-north-east, accelerate, and track across the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the northeast Gulf coast of Florida (Big Bend area).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (around Cedar Key–Indian Pass area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch from Englewood to Indian Pass, FL (includes Tampa Bay); Storm Surge Watch from Chokoloskee to Indian Pass, FL (includes Tampa Bay)
weather_observation.warning_coast: None at this time for Florida coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northeast Gulf coast of Florida from southwest of Tampa northward to the Big Bend and eastern Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) are probable; hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out if the center tracks just north of Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: NHC guidance indicates 3–5 ft of surge possible in Tampa Bay if peak surge coincides with high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches with locally higher amounts up to 10 inches possible, leading to flash and urban flooding around Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornadoes in outer rainbands, very rough seas in the approaches to the port, large breaking waves along the bay entrance channels.
